intro: Crucianella divaricata, commonly known as the variable sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by water. Crucianella divaricata is adapted to saltwater environments and is often found in tidal zones along the Atlantic coast.
